definitions.definition: one of four equal parts of something
definitions.labels: especially in North American English(especially North American English)

examples.text: a **quarter of an hour/a century**
a quarter of a mile/million
Almost a quarter of respondents reported employment discrimination.
three quarters of all potential customers
The programme lasted an hour and a quarter.
Cut the apple into quarters.
The theatre was about three quarters full.
He completed his last work a quarter century ago.

definitions.definition: a period of 15 minutes either before or after every hour

examples.text: It’s (a) quarter to four now—I’ll meet you at (a) quarter past.
It's quarter of four now—I'll meet you at quarter after.

definitions.definition: a period of three months, used especially as a period for which bills are paid or a company’s income is calculated

examples.text: The rent is due at the end of each quarter.
Our gas bill for the last quarter was much higher than usual.
Sales were down 10% in the first quarter of 2024.
Profits fell during the third quarter.
the current fiscal quarter
six consecutive quarters of improved earnings

definitions.definition: a district or part of a town

examples.text: the historic quarter of the city
As a student in Paris, she loved the Latin quarter.
The robbery took place in a normally quiet quarter of the town.

definitions.definition: a person or group of people, especially as a source of help, information or a reaction

examples.text: Support for the plan came from an unexpected quarter.
The news was greeted with dismay **in some quarters**.
The move was met with complaints **from all quarters** *(= from everyone)*.
The problem was being discussed in all quarters.
There was no comment from official quarters on the allegations.

definitions.definition: a coin of the US and Canada worth 25 cents
rooms that are provided for soldiers, servants, etc. to live in

examples.text: We were moved to more comfortable **living quarters**.
the servants'/officers' quarters
He was confined to quarters as a punishment.
The corporal and his family lived in married quarters.
the president's private quarters

definitions.definition: the period of time twice a month when we can see a quarter of the moon

examples.text: The moon is in its first quarter.

definitions.definition: one of the four periods of time into which a game of American football is divided

examples.text: Ford scored the winning touchdown early in the fourth quarter.

definitions.definition: a unit for measuring weight, a quarter of a pound; 4 ounces
a unit for measuring weight, 28 pounds in the UK or 25 pounds in the US; a quarter of a hundredweight
kind treatment of an enemy or opponent who is in your power

examples.text: His rivals knew that they could expect no quarter from such a ruthless adversary.
fighting at close quarters

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French quartier, from Latin quartarius ‘fourth part of a measure’, from quartus ‘fourth’, from quattuor ‘four’.
